image.altText: woman sits on a cream couch with a cup in front of her resting on a table. She is wearing a patterned top and glasses.

props.synopsis: Faced with declining use of their assets, the firms that own Australia's gas pipelines are trying to shield themselves from the risks of their networks becoming stranded — and customers are paying the tab.

title.children: Hundreds of dollars added to bills as gas companies write down asset losses

image.altText: Peter Dutton speaking with hands out, Anthony Albanese in the background.

props.synopsis: Both the prime minister and the opposition leader hit their marks in the first debate but the opposition leader was under more pressure to perform after a truly horrendous week.

title.children: Debate has not reversed nightmare week for Dutton despite his best efforts

image.altText: A composite image of Donald Trump and Xi Jinping. Both are wearing a blue suit, blue tie and have a neutral facial expression.

props.synopsis: The US president has taken to social media to say he is confident Beijing will call as a 104 per cent tariff deadline looms.

title.children: Trump awaits China's call on tariffs as deadline looms for 104 per cent levy

image.altText: Elon Musk sits in the Oval Office wearing a red baseball cap that says: "Trump was right about everything"

props.synopsis: Elon Musk calls Donald Trump's top trade adviser a "moron", escalating tensions over tariffs within the US president's inner sanctum, as some White House officials indicate deals could be on the table.

title.children: Australia 'sucked into recession' under worst-case Trump trade war scenario

image.altText: Giant screen on the wall of the ASX, with large red numbers, showing the price of shares which have fallen.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market has fallen 2pc at the open, resuming its slide after yesterday's rebound, with US shares dipping again ahead of the scheduled implementation of reciprocal US tariffs later today. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Australian stocks slide as traders brace for tariffs to take effect

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Power company fined for removing hardship protections
Let's look at the broader sectors now

image.altText: A man in a tux pointing at the camera

props.synopsis: A series of policies have up-ended the global trade system and wiped trillions of dollars of value from the face of the Earth. Here's what could happen next.

title.children: Under Trump's tariffs, here's how the world could look in the near future

image.altText: The wreckage of a helicopter on a sand bank with emergency services standing nearby

props.synopsis: The Australian Transport Safety Burea report has found a series of safety issues contributed to the crash that killed four people and injured nine others in 2023.

title.children: Faulty radio antenna contributed to fatal Sea World helicopter crash, final report finds

image.altText: Chris Minns stands smiling next to Anthony Albanese

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton have begun their day in Sydney following their first leaders' debate of the campaign. Follow live.

title.children: NSW premier says Dutton's policies have the 'life span of warm yoghurt'

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Coalition unveils modelling behind gas policy
Is the US 'running up the score' on Australia? Its trade representative seems to think so

image.altText: The two divers in the water after being spotted by crew members on board Rottnest Fast Ferries.

props.synopsis: Two brothers who were left behind in the ocean during a diving expedition off the Perth coast say they feared they wouldn't survive the ordeal.

title.children: 'Treated it like a joke': Divers left behind off Perth coast furious at company

image.altText: Donald Trump standing in front of the American flag

props.synopsis: As Donald Trump's tariffs continue to roil financial markets, economists say the risk for Australia is if the economy of China, the nation's largest trading partner, is damaged by the trade war.

title.children: What Trump's tariffs mean for possibility of recession in Australia

image.altText: a composite image of two boys, seen from behind

props.synopsis: Years after two brothers with disabilities were found naked and locked in a room in a Brisbane home, the Queensland Education department has been urged to make sure suspicions of harm are "appropriately recorded".

title.children: Call for better reporting after brothers found naked and malnourished

image.altText: orcas in the ocean and birds flying above the water

props.synopsis: Scientists and tourists are left in awe by a rare and dramatic encounter off the state's south coast.

title.children: Marine biologist and tourists in awe as 60 orcas attack blue whale

image.altText: New Eurovision hosts promo 2

props.synopsis: Former ABC presenter Tony Armstrong and drag icon Courtney Act will present Australia's Eurovision coverage live from Switzerland.

title.children: Tony Armstrong and Courtney Act set to host Australia's Eurovision coverage

image.altText: A four-year-old boy wearing shorts and a t-shirt sits on the grass with a broad smile on his face.

props.synopsis: The mother of a boy who is Deafblind is frustrated after being told her son wouldn't have the one-on-one assistance he needs to understand lessons in his preferred setting.

title.children: Parents 'confused and baffled' by school inclusion policies

image.altText: Cheng Chau Brisbane casino

props.synopsis: Star and its Chinese partner both did business with the disgraced Suncity junket. It is set to cost one of them a share in Australia's most expensive casino.

title.children: Hidden ties to crime figure no barrier for Brisbane casino takeover

image.altText: Close-up side profile of a blonde woman with large earrings and red lipstick on a red carpet.

props.synopsis: The pop superstar is bringing her MAYHEM Ball tour to Australia, playing shows at stadiums in Melbourne, Sydney and Brisbane.

title.children: Lady Gaga announces first Australian shows in 11 years

image.altText: Composite image of Charles Dance, Thom Yorke, and Julianne Moore on various red carpets

props.synopsis: Thousands of creatives have signed the petition which calls for an end to the unlicensed use of creative work to train generative AI models.

title.children: Statement against AI training passes 50,000 signatures

image.altText: A box and vial of the Measles, Mumps, Rubella Virus Vaccine at a vaccine clinic.

props.synopsis: Adults can catch and spread the disease, especially if they are under-vaccinated — a category many Australians might find themselves in. Here's what you need to know about getting fully vaccinated against measles.

title.children: Measles is circulating. Do adults need to get vaccinated?

image.altText: JD Vance speaking at a lectern, a close up photo of him.

props.synopsis: The US vice president's comments have been widely circulated on Chinese social media and received a sharp rebuke from Beijing.

title.children: JD Vance called 'ignorant and impolite' by China over 'peasants' remark

image.altText: Sarah McBride with her daughter conceived through IVF

props.synopsis: Last week the federal health department accepted an expanded definition of infertility that would allow LGBTIQ+ couples and single people like Sarah McBride to be able to access Medicare rebates for assisted reproductive technology.

title.children: 'Socially infertile' people like Sarah can now access Medicare rebates

image.altText: Min Woo Lee plays a shot at Masters practice

props.synopsis: Jason Day hopes compatriot Min Woo Lee heeds advice given by golf legend Karrie Webb as Lee heads into the Masters as Australia's best bet.

title.children: Lee urged to consider 'lifestyle change' in order to conquer Masters

image.altText: Sunday Show Rd 5

props.synopsis: Zac Lomax kicks a field-goal to win a game for Parramatta only for scans to reveal a foot fracture that pits him in a race against time to be fit for the NSW Blues' State of Origin campaign.

title.children: Lomax in doubt for Origin opener, scans reveal game-winning kick came with a broken foot

image.altText: A young Amanda Knox, with long brown hair, is led into a room by a female police officer

props.synopsis: Amanda Knox reflects on 18 years of public opinion, our favourite Parks and Recreation characters reunite, and a son tries to pull his dad out of a conspiracy rabbit hole in the best podcasts this month.

title.children: Amanda Knox reflects on almost 20 years of unwanted publicity

image.altText: People walking in front of a hospital of Mexico

props.synopsis: The three-year-old girl was hospitalised with respiratory complications and later died from multiple organ failures. However, it remains unknown how she contracted bird flu.

title.children: Mexico reports first human death from H5N1 bird flu

image.altText: Volodymyr Zelenskyy wearing a black top and standing emotionless alongside a Ukrainian flag

props.synopsis: In a post on the encrypted messaging service Telegram, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy claims to have information about "significantly more Chinese citizens" serving in Russian military units, and says he has ordered his foreign minister to contact Beijing.

title.children: Zelenskyy says Chinese soldiers captured fighting alongside Russians in Ukraine

image.altText: Vladimir Putin rests his head against his hand, with one finger pointed towards his temple

props.synopsis: The International Criminal Court has issued arrest warrants for Vladimir Putin and Benjamin Netanyahu, but is the court working as it should be?

title.children: Will Putin or Netanyahu ever face the International Criminal Court?

image.altText: Michael Malone with his left hand on his chin

props.synopsis: Michael Malone loses his job as Denver Nuggets head coach a week before the NBA playoffs begin and less than two years after leading his side to a drought-breaking championship.

title.children: NBA coach fired three games before playoffs and two years after winning title

image.altText: A woman with short grey hair stands next to a brightly coloured painting of two women in floral outfits.

props.synopsis: Alfred Wolmark became a pioneering painter after fleeing persecution in Europe in the 1880s. His family hope offering his work in Australia will help keep his legacy alive.

title.children: Alfred Wolmark paintings sold at Australian public auction for first time

image.altText: Mitch Marsh holds his bat in both hands after a pull shot

props.synopsis: Mitch Marsh continues his red-hot form in the Indian Premier League to help his side win an all-time great clash as the other Australians in action overnight all struggle.

title.children: Marsh continues golden form to help team claim 472-run IPL thriller

image.altText: Declan Rice pumps his right fist in celebration

props.synopsis: Declan Rice scores two sensational free kicks as Arsenal beats Real Madrid in 3-0 in the first leg of their blockbuster UEFA Champions League clash.

title.children: Pair of stunning free kick goals see Arsenal topple Real Madrid in Champions League

image.altText: Peter Dutton and Angus Taylor behind a podium.

props.synopsis: Government administration experts have warned that while it is possible to shrink the public service through natural attrition, it would be difficult to avoid impacting service delivery.

title.children: Most public service attrition overlaps with service delivery roles

image.altText: Brahman cattle in the Gulf Savannah.

props.synopsis: Floodwater across outback Queensland is receding but mosquitoes and sandflies carrying a potentially fatal disease are spoiling the reprieve for already battered cattle.

title.children: Mosquitoes may be a death sentence for cattle after epic outback flood

image.altText: Mine worker with trucks in the background.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory government wants workers in the gas and mining sector to settle in the NT, as it aims to boost the population by 4,000 people per year.

title.children: NT government flags less FIFO work as territory population lags

image.altText: A businesswoman with serious expression wearing a purple blazer.

props.synopsis: North Queensland towns sweating on benefits from a $13.9 billion transmission line say they need certainty in the face of major changes and delays.

title.children: Delays to billion-dollar project leave towns hanging in the balance

image.altText: Rowan De Silva looks ahead while standing in a garden area next to a green fence and with housing behind

props.synopsis: South Australian trans youth are frustrated by wait times to see psychiatrists before receiving gender-affirming care. 19-year-old Rowan De Silva says sometimes it feels like there are "meaningless obstacles".

title.children: Trans youth frustrated by wait times for gender-affirming care
